column4: i have problem getting out my PHILIPS cdrom device from some powersave(?) state (any command connecting device (mount, hdparm etc.) just hang till reboot). Device: "PHILIPS CD-RW/DVD-ROM SCB5265, ATAPI CD/DVD-ROM drive", Kernel: "2.6.15-26-686 #1 SMP PREEMPT"
did you play with hdparm?
any command affecting device just hangs (i.e. sudo hdparm -w /dev/hdc)
sudo hdparm -b /dev/hdc
then maybe try sudo hdparm -B 255 /dev/hdc
nothing. Yet another command that do not respondseaven to kill -9
there's a whole bunch of options: try hdparm -C
problem is - ANY command accessing device hangs permanently
have you made changes in /etc/hdparm.conf ?
I think the thing to do is get /etc/hdparm.conf right, then reboot
I have -c3 -d1 -u
add -B 255 which will disable apm
Its not good sign - I'm on laptop
I'm back w my CDROM problem. hdparm -B has no effect on device, device works after manualy using hdparm -y or -Y
that's a bit wierd, but glad it works
it could be bug in firmware? (there is no update for this drive)
most wired - it works after standby or suspend IF it was working (active) before that
what state is the battery in?
it doesnt matter - it happens hwn on AC or on battery
I will try to disable any PM ir BIOS
trouble is, lappies thrive on good power management, really needs to get fixed, maybe file a bug, or search launchpad
